name: FRC Penultimate Manual
description: All-in-one manual for FRC teams and team members.

name: The Blue Alliance
description: FRC's leading event, team, and match tracker.

name: The Compass Alliance
description: A resource for learning about all FRC topic, made for any level of experience.

name: State Space Guide
description: A practical guide to state-space control: graduate-level control theory for high schoolers.

name: GradleRIO
description: A powerful Gradle Plugin that allows teams competing in the FIRST robotics competition to produce and build their code.

name: CTR Electronics
description: Supplier of many popular parts certified for FRC use, including the Talon SRX's and Victor SPX's.

name: AndyMark
description: A supplier for the educational robotics market, focusing particularly on FIRST.

name: VEXpro
description: A distributor of parts for FRC, FTC, and VEX formed by FIRST alumni.

name: McMaster-Carr
description: A comprehensive index of parts for many applications, from fasteners to pneumatics.

name: REV Robotics
description: Distributor of many FIRST Legal mechanical and electrical parts, including NEO Brushless Motors and Spark MAX Motor Controllers.

name: West Coast Products
description: A company founded by FIRST alumni that aims to distribute reliable and high-quality parts.

name: FRC Programming Done Right
description: Exhaustive and well-written guide to programming in FRC, the right way.

name: WPILib ScreenSteps
description: Old and unsupported documentation for hardware and officially supported software languages. For up to date, check below.

name: WPILib Docs
description: Up-to-date documentation on FRC hardware and software for 2020 and beyond.

name: CSCore
description: The CScore camera vision library from WPI.

name: 254 2016 Vision Talk
description: The most complete lesson about vision tracking out there.

name: 2729 Storm Robotics Vision
description: An example of using OpenCV and GRIP to create a vision system.

name: Limelight
description: A plug-and-play vision solution built for FRC.

name: ChickenVision
description: An easy to implement vision system created by Team 3997.

name: Robot Scouter
description: Gorgeous and powerful Android scouting app.

name: VictiScout
description: Light Electron scouting app by Team 1418.

name: QDriverStation
description: Popular open-source Driver Station clone for all Desktop platforms. Though not permitted in competition, essential for teams wishing to drive on another platform or up their open source cred.

name: FRCDashboard
description: Powerful and flexible boilerplate for creating complex driving dashboards with web technologies.

name: SmartDashboard.js
description: SmartDashboard port written in JavaScript with nw.js.

name: /r/FRC
description: The one and only FRC subreddit.

name: Chief Delphi
description: The essential forum for all things FRC.

name: Discord Server
description: Chat community for robotics advice and socialization with other FRC students, mentors, and alumni. The absolute best place to go for FRC discussion.

name: Discord Server List
description: List of unofficial regional, organizational, and community servers for FRC.

name: WPILib
description: The official WPILib repository, containing code for the Java and C++ libraries.

name: SmartDashboard
description: The official SmartDashboard repository containing code for the Java Driver Station dashboard.

name: Shuffleboard
description: A clean Driver Station dashboard for FIRST teams.

name: Sertain
description: A framework which builds upon WPILib and makes programming a robot in Kotlin beautiful.

name: ROOSTER
description: A common library of useful classes and systems for FIRST.

name: FalconLibrary
description: A library for programming robots in Kotlin, made by Team 5190.

name: SnobotSim
description: A program that can simulate FRC robots programmed in Java.

name: Lib5K
description: A robotics library developed by team 5024

name: WPILib (Java/C++)
description: The official WPILib repository, containing code for the Java and C++ libraries.

name: BaseBot
description: A complete rewrite of barebonesFRC that is heavily optimized to run as fast as possible and use the bare minimum amount of resources during periodic functions.

name: WPILib (C#)
description: Unofficial WPILib port for writing robot code in C#.

name: NetworkTables (C#)
description: Unofficial NetworkTables port for C#.

name: FRC-Extension (Visual Studio)
description: Visual Studio extension to make writing C# robots a breeze.

name: RobotPy-WPILib
description: Unofficial WPILib port allowing you to write robot code in Python.

name: pyrobottraining
description: Fundamental tutorial for FRC robot coding in Python.

name: pynetworktables
description: Port to allow access of NetworkTables in Python.

name: TBApi
description: A Python library for interacting with The Blue Alliance API.

name: banners.css
description: Library for creating pure CSS FRC banners. Utilitarian and pretty decoration for team websites.

name: tba.rb
description: Simple Ruby library for easy interaction with The Blue Alliance API.

name: TBA Node API
description: A Node.js library for interacting with The Blue Alliance API.

name: FIRST on YouTube
description: FIRST's official YouTube channel.

name: Game Animations
description: Playlist of every game release video since 2003.

name: Reveal Videos
description: Playlist of the best robot reveal videos.

name: FIRST Map
description: Beautiful map of the world's FRC teams.

name: FRC New Tab
description: Chrome extension to fill your New Tab page with a random FRC team, or show the team with a number corresponding to the current time.

name: FRC Bot
description: Facebook Messenger bot to get information about FRC teams, events, and matches.
